reviews.text:
Love the location. So many great wine bars, restaurants and a running path nearby.

Hotel itself is fairly basic. It has a good breakfast spread

I spent 2 nights at the hotel and I can recommend it. Clean rooms, awesome breakfast and the stuff was very kind. There is a small gym and you can find a bicycle rental station in front of the building.
If you decide to walk it takes only 15 minutes to get in city center.
They even made me early ‚Äúbreakfast to go‚Äùwhen I was leaving at 5am üëè
I would like to come back again.

Not quite up to four-star standards‚Äîmore like a solid three. My first room was noisy, located right next to the road. I requested a quieter room at the front, but was told there were no available rooms or upgrades (apparently, front rooms must be requested in advance).

My standard room, while clean, was very basic, small and felt quite worn. There were signs of neglect, like painted-over sockets with peeling paint and fixtures that had seen better days. The space overall lacked the attention to detail and comfort expected of a four-star property. For instance, there was no tea or coffee set, and the iron provided was basic, along with a tiny, torn ironing board.

Breakfast was a standard buffet with nothing memorable.

Comfort at a reasonable price. Shower pressure a bit low but the facilities are very modern.  Wonderful breakfast included.   I enjoyed the salmon and eggs every morning plus the wide variety of fruit, meats, breads and fabulous coffee. Helpful staff.  Clean. Security is a priority. Great location next to the Mathallen which has a large range of restaurants and bars all under one roof.  Easy access to town centers by bus (cash only or purchase tickets at 7-11).

This hotel was chosen for its location and, for me, the inside carpark.
A note to any motorcyclist :
Reception casually told me to park in the car park. On day one, i did.
On the second day, i met a security guard who looked after the car park.
He advised me to move my bike and park it in P2, which was a level below. Motorcycles are free to park on P2. With a dedicated area. If I'd left it on P3, I'd have received a hefty bill.
When you drive into the car park, you are greeted with only one entrance. However, further round are the other entrances.
The receptionist knew I was on a Moto, and really should have explained this.
Rooms are nice. Roomy and clean.
Breakfast is fantastic. Huge selection. Everything you could want. Can get very busy at peak times.
We used this hotel for its location. The whole city is within 20 mins walking.
I will use this hotel again.
